You can convert the PDF's to CBZ's or CBR's pretty easily with Acrobat.

Thanks for your efforts, INEEDASTUPIDUSERNAME. I imagine it took you quite a while, good work.  That said, PDFs are a pain in the ass to read digital comics on.  If you have ever DLed a DCP or Minutemen pack, they are always in cbr or cbz format, read with cDisplay and some other programs (called sequential image viewers).
Those interested in converting, you can use the Pro version of Acrobat to export all the jpegs, zip or rar (archive) them and rename the extension to .cbz or .cbr respectively.  Also, theres an Open Source app called GhostScript which will also export jpegs from PDFs and a reader called ComicRack that will convert them, too.  That's a lot of work for 547 comics, though.
Hey thanks for this!  I'm trying to export these to jpegs and it keeps asking for the "file password".  Can you help?

Thanks very much for this. For those of you saying "Wow, great job compiling this," you should know that this is a title of software, not a user-complied collection. You can buy this at any software store.
